sentences.english: Donation of 550 wheelchairs at Qinyang, Henan on May 22, 2008.
sentences.chinese: 天鄰基金會捐贈550張輪椅河南省沁陽市殘疾人士。

sentences.english: Have you been interviewed for a post with Youchange Foundation?
sentences.chinese: 您以前是否面試過友成基金會的其他職位？

sentences.english: He contributed half of his savings to the relief fund.
sentences.chinese: 他將積蓄的一半捐獻給救濟基金會。

sentences.english: The foundation was set up to collect funds for the boy.
sentences.chinese: 該基金會的建立是爲薩帕馬加籌集資金。

sentences.english: Therefore, we will make a contribution to The Rotary Foundation as our expression of thanks.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我們將對扶輪基金會捐獻，以聊表謝忱。

sentences.english: Rolex is owned by the Hans Wilsdorf Foundation.
sentences.chinese: 漢斯維爾斯多夫基金會擁有勞力士公司。

sentences.english: The Gates Foundation hopes that further research will see such reforms replicated elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 蓋茨基金會希望，這種教改可普遍到其他各地。

sentences.english: That is why I decided to give the money to this foundation.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我決定把這筆錢用在這個基金會的原因。

sentences.english: The name of a public offering foundation may not use a trade name.
sentences.chinese: 公募基金會的名稱可以不使用字號。

sentences.english: The Wellcome Trust funded the study.
sentences.chinese: 維康基金會爲該項研究提供資金。

sentences.english: Funds should respond to the inquiry of donators faithfully and in time.
sentences.chinese: 對於捐贈人的查詢，基金會應當及時如實答覆。

sentences.english: But its impact on Chinese science and technology should not diminish.
sentences.chinese: 但求是科技基金會在中國科技界的影響力絕不減褪。

sentences.english: He delivered lectures on the Hibbert foundation at Manchester College.
sentences.chinese: 他領取希伯特基金會提供的酬金在曼徹斯特學院講課。

sentences.english: All his money went into the foundation which was named after his teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他所有的錢進了基金會命名他的老師。

sentences.english: One ambitious goal of the foundation is to wipe polio off the face of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 基金會的另一宏偉目標是讓脊髓灰質炎在地球上消失。

sentences.english: He has received The Rotary Foundation's Citation for Meritorious Service and Distinguished Service Award.
sentences.chinese: 他曾獲頒扶輪基金會的有功服務獎及特優服務獎。

definition: to organize/to host (a conference or sports event)
to originate/to initiate/to launch (an attack, an initiative etc)/to start/to propose sth (for the first time)
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
